subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Megachurches: Faith as Entertainment
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Megachurches: Faith as Entertainment.

hook.text: Rock bands, light shows, coffee shops, 20,000 seats. Megachurches turned worship into an experience. Is God in the show?

buildup.text: The megachurch movement exploded in the 1980s. Joel Osteen's Lakewood Church meets in a former basketball arena.

discovery.text: They grow by removing barriers: no liturgy, no guilt, no dress code. The message is positive and the coffee is free.

twist.text: Critics call it Christianity Lite: all comfort, no challenge. Prosperity gospel says God wants you rich. Convenient.

climax.text: Megachurches succeed because they meet people where they are. Whether that's wisdom or compromise depends on your view.

punchline.text: Megachurches removed barriers. Critics ask: did they also remove the depth?

quiz.question: What is a megachurch?
options: A large church with thousands of members using entertainment-style worship
